result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA Authorization to Defense re Electronic Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim J.J (person, property, residence or family). You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken and to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Fingerprinting hours are Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 9:00 A.M. - 11:00 A.M. or between 1:00 P.M. - 4:00 P.M.  DNA hours are Monday through Friday between 9:00 A.M. - 11:30 A.M.

2:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Malik M Stuckey in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
